input_sentence: At intersections if there is another vehicle in right of ego then ego must yield to other vehicle, provided there is no traffic sign number 306 in front of ego.

atomic_propositions.description: Other vehicle is on right side of ego
Sign 306 is in front of ego

temporal_relations.description: At intersection with vehicle on right and no sign 306, ego must yield

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
1. Extract object mapping from objects list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_sign → sign_306

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: in_right_of(other,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]
   - ap_3: yield(ego,other) [relational predicate with other as related_object]
   - ap_4: in_front_of(sign_306,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: at_intersection(ego) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

Final MTL Formula:
G ((at_intersection(ego) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)) -> yield(ego,other))

synthesis_result.synthesis_reasoning:
1. Extract object mapping from objects list:
   - obj_ego → ego
   - obj_other → other  
   - obj_sign → sign_306

2. Construct predicate(object) forms for each atomic proposition:
   - ap_1: at_intersection(ego) [unary predicate]
   - ap_2: in_right_of(other,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]
   - ap_3: yield(ego,other) [relational predicate with other as related_object]
   - ap_4: in_front_of(sign_306,ego) [relational predicate with ego as related_object]

3. Build the conditional structure from temporal_relations:
   - Antecedent: at_intersection(ego) & in_right_of(other,ego) & ~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)
   - Consequent: yield(ego,other)

4. Apply global property "Always" using G operator

stage_results.agent_response:
Reasoning Process:
- The formula begins with the global operator `G`, meaning "Always" or "Globally" that the following implication must hold.
- The antecedent (condition) combines three predicates with logical operators:
  - `at_intersection(ego)` is a unary predicate meaning "ego is at an intersection".
  - `in_right_of(other,ego)` is a relational predicate meaning "other is on the right side of ego".
  - `~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)` is a negated relational predicate meaning "sign_306 is not in front of ego".
- The consequent is `yield(ego,other)`, a relational predicate meaning "ego yields to other".
- The entire implication structure `(A & B & C) -> D` translates to "if A and B and C, then D".
- All predicates preserve object information, specifying "ego", "other", and "sign_306" as involved entities.

Natural Language Translation:
Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection, another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, and sign 306 is not in front of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

verification_result.back_translation: Always, if the ego vehicle is at an intersection, another vehicle is on the right side of the ego vehicle, and sign 306 is not in front of the ego vehicle, then the ego vehicle must yield to the other vehicle.

  - `~in_front_of(sign_306,ego)` is a negated relational predicate meaning "sign_306 is not in front of ego".
- The consequent is `yield(ego,other)`, a relational predicate meaning "ego yields to other".
- The entire implication structure `(A & B & C) -> D` translates to "if A and B and C, then D".

analyst.name: Analyst_Agent
analyst.description: Responsible for deconstructing natural language into structured semantic components

synthesizer.name: Synthesizer_Agent
synthesizer.description: Responsible for synthesizing syntactically correct MTL formulas from semantic components
